qas.question: What religious festival is also known as the festival of light?
What cultural event showcases dancers and musicians from all over India?
In what location is The Qutub Festival held?
The Spring Festival which is held each year in Delhi is also known by what name?
What is the name of the fruit related festival held annually in Delhi?

context: Religious festivals include <a0_0>Diwali<a0_0/> (the festival of light), Maha Shivaratri, Teej, Guru Nanak Jayanti, Baisakhi, Durga Puja, Holi, Lohri, Eid ul-Fitr, Eid ul-Adha, Christmas, Chhath Puja and Mahavir Jayanti. <a1_0>The Qutub Festival<a1_0/> is a cultural event during which performances of musicians and dancers from all over India are showcased at night, with <a2_0>the Qutub Minar<a2_0/> as the chosen backdrop of the event. Other events such as Kite Flying Festival, <a4_0>International Mango Festival<a4_0/> and <a3_0>Vasant Panchami<a3_0/> (the Spring Festival) are held every year in Delhi.
